content: Following Extract From: guardian.co.uk World news Web "Prospect of Barack Obama show causes UK to clear its decks With an entourage of 500 staff, an armour-plated limousine and a fleet of decoy helicopters, America's new president will arrive for his first visit to Britain amid huge razzmatazz on Tuesday for the G20 summit. But it will be his closed-door meetings with world leaders that are likely to prove the most significant of the trip." Paul Harris in New York and Robin McKie The Observer, Sunday 29 March 2009 See: "http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/29/obama-london-visit-uk-g20/print" To me, this is Obama's obnoxious self-gratification (to include over 500 staff members on this trip). Decoy Helicopters and 200 or more Secret Service agents is "overdoing" it a bit! Simply, its being a "Showoff!" Just my Opinion! From A Proud Vietnam Veteran

But it will be his closed-door meetings with world leaders that are likely to prove the most significant of the trip." Paul Harris in New York and Robin McKie The Observer, Sunday 29 March 2009 See: "http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/29/obama-london-visit-uk-g20/print" To me, this is Obama's obnoxious self-gratification (to include over 500 staff members on this trip). content: quote: Originally posted by WesLemmon: Following Extract From: guardian.co.uk World news Web "Prospect of Barack Obama show causes UK to clear its decks With an entourage of 500 staff, an armour-plated limousine and a fleet of decoy helicopters, America's new president will arrive for his first visit to Britain amid huge razzmatazz on Tuesday for the G20 summit. But it will be his closed-door meetings with world leaders that are likely to prove the most significant of the trip." Paul Harris in New York and Robin McKie The Observer, Sunday 29 March 2009 See: "http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/29/obama-london-visit-uk-g20/print" To me, this is Obama's obnoxious self-gratification (to include over 500 staff members on this trip). Decoy Helicopters and 200 or more Secret Service agents is "overdoing" it a bit! Simply, its being a "Showoff!" Just my Opinion! From A Proud Vietnam Veteran I read this same idiotic complaint in my local paper recently and figured that someone probably had posted the same drivel as another excuse to Bash Obama and I had just missed it. Sure enough here it is... If your pizzed off about President Obama having the same protection as President Bush then you surly weren’t too pleased with President Bush breaking the bank back in 07 on his trip to the AEPC conference. George Bush arrives in Sydney for APEC By Joe Hildebrand, Political Reporter September 04, 2007 10:24pm US President George W Bush and his 1000-strong entourage have touched down in Sydney, triggering the biggest security lockdown in the city's history. Amid howls of protest from a small band of demonstrators in the city, Air Force One arrived at Sydney Airport at 10.19pm in front of an international media throng. Security measures for the president's arrival and four-day visit are the toughest the city has ever seen. A strong police presence outnumbered and outflanked the 50-odd protesters at Railway Square, including known troublemakers on the State Government's "excluded persons'' list. Sydneysiders have been warned to prepare for massive upheaval to transport and other services. The two major routes to Sydney Airport were the subject of a massive security operation from 8pm last night, causing major disruptions to other motorists. Mr Bush stepped from the plane unaccompanied. He walked down the stairs and was greeted by Deputy Prime Minister Mark Vaile, NSW Premier Morris Iemma and other dignitaries, including Australia's ambassador to the US, Denis Richardson. Shortly after Mr Bush was followed from the plane by US Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice. At the same time, swarm of Secret Servce agents, other personnel and press emerged from the rear of Air Force One. Mr Bush, who was wearing a light-grey suit and powder-blue tie, waved several times to the asssmebled media and security personnel. He then hopped into one of two black armour-plated limousines, which, with the president on-board, is known as Cadillac One. His vehicle left the tarmac in a convoy of no less than 40 vehicles, headed by two NSW police cars and including six ambulances and two paramedic motorcycles. The convoy has been given a green light run along Southern Cross Drive and the Eastern Distributor, up to Macquarie Street in the city and to the Intercontinental Hotel, where the president is staying in a seven-room suite. The O'Riordan Street route to the airport also had a heavy security presence as a precautionary measure and even as late as yesterday there were still rumours the president would be landing at Richmond air base. Accompanying the president was expected to be 150 national security advisers, 250 Secret Service agents, 200 public servants, 50 political aides, 15 sniffer dog teams and even five chefs. The presidential 747 was accompanied by a second identical stand-in plane and followed by a third jumbo jet carrying 150 White House journalists, medical staff, advisers, public servants, Secret Service agents, dogs and cooks. It is understood two or three transport planes carrying the presidential helicopter, Marine One, and dozens of motorcade vehicles including limousines, Secret Service wagons, VIP guest vans and an ambulance deployed in Sydney around two days ago to be ready for the president's arrival. The total 1,000-strong delegation is more than three times larger than any other country, including the 300-strong Australian team. Snip http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,22365089-5006009,00.html What’s changed since then? Oh, that’s right, instead of an R designating the Presidents Political party it’s been replace by a D. So it must be (at least according to you guys) that this President is not entitled to the same scope of protection as the ones with the R. It's also just my opinion that the hypocrisy that is evident in this thread knows no bounds.

But it will be his closed-door meetings with world leaders that are likely to prove the most significant of the trip." Paul Harris in New York and Robin McKie The Observer, Sunday 29 March 2009 See: "http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/29/obama-london-visit-uk-g20/print" To me, this is Obama's obnoxious self-gratification (to include over 500 staff members on this trip). Decoy Helicopters and 200 or more Secret Service agents is "overdoing" it a bit! Simply, its being a "Showoff!" Just my Opinion! From A Proud Vietnam Veteran

title: Over 500 Staff to Accompany Obama on Eurpean Trip

content: I was a C-5 loadmaster in a the mid 90s while Clinton was in office, and there had to be at least 500 people that went overseas with him. It would take a half a dozen C-5s to support the WCHA, motorcade, and helicopter support plus extra planes were on alert if needed. Like him or not he is the President and griping about who goes with him is really dumb.
reply: I was a C-5 loadmaster in a the mid 90s while Clinton was in office, and there had to be at least 500 people that went overseas with him. content: Ah yes, US Presidents and their entourages the absolute definition of ostentatious over-consumption. You lot do realise that about 75% of the stuff your head-sheds take on trips is only there for show don't you? Mind you at least Obama's lot chose to only clog up Stanstead airport for a few hours with their three (and that's just on the day - why?) jet carnival. Last time round Bush chose to go to Heathrow (the busiest airport in Europe) and screwed up air-traffic for half the planet.

title: Over 500 Staff to Accompany Obama on Eurpean Trip

content: quote: Originally posted by WesLemmon: Following Extract From: guardian.co.uk World news Web "Prospect of Barack Obama show causes UK to clear its decks With an entourage of 500 staff, an armour-plated limousine and a fleet of decoy helicopters, America's new president will arrive for his first visit to Britain amid huge razzmatazz on Tuesday for the G20 summit. But it will be his closed-door meetings with world leaders that are likely to prove the most significant of the trip." Paul Harris in New York and Robin McKie The Observer, Sunday 29 March 2009 See: "http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/29/obama-london-visit-uk-g20/print" To me, this is Obama's obnoxious self-gratification (to include over 500 staff members on this trip). Decoy Helicopters and 200 or more Secret Service agents is "overdoing" it a bit! Simply, its being a "Showoff!" Just my Opinion! From A Proud Vietnam Veteran I read this same idiotic complaint in my local paper recently and figured that someone probably had posted the same drivel as another excuse to Bash Obama and I had just missed it. Sure enough here it is... If your pizzed off about President Obama having the same protection as President Bush then you surly weren’t too pleased with President Bush breaking the bank back in 07 on his trip to the AEPC conference. George Bush arrives in Sydney for APEC By Joe Hildebrand, Political Reporter September 04, 2007 10:24pm US President George W Bush and his 1000-strong entourage have touched down in Sydney, triggering the biggest security lockdown in the city's history. Amid howls of protest from a small band of demonstrators in the city, Air Force One arrived at Sydney Airport at 10.19pm in front of an international media throng. Security measures for the president's arrival and four-day visit are the toughest the city has ever seen. A strong police presence outnumbered and outflanked the 50-odd protesters at Railway Square, including known troublemakers on the State Government's "excluded persons'' list. Sydneysiders have been warned to prepare for massive upheaval to transport and other services. The two major routes to Sydney Airport were the subject of a massive security operation from 8pm last night, causing major disruptions to other motorists. Mr Bush stepped from the plane unaccompanied. He walked down the stairs and was greeted by Deputy Prime Minister Mark Vaile, NSW Premier Morris Iemma and other dignitaries, including Australia's ambassador to the US, Denis Richardson. Shortly after Mr Bush was followed from the plane by US Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice. At the same time, swarm of Secret Servce agents, other personnel and press emerged from the rear of Air Force One. Mr Bush, who was wearing a light-grey suit and powder-blue tie, waved several times to the asssmebled media and security personnel. He then hopped into one of two black armour-plated limousines, which, with the president on-board, is known as Cadillac One. His vehicle left the tarmac in a convoy of no less than 40 vehicles, headed by two NSW police cars and including six ambulances and two paramedic motorcycles. The convoy has been given a green light run along Southern Cross Drive and the Eastern Distributor, up to Macquarie Street in the city and to the Intercontinental Hotel, where the president is staying in a seven-room suite. The O'Riordan Street route to the airport also had a heavy security presence as a precautionary measure and even as late as yesterday there were still rumours the president would be landing at Richmond air base. Accompanying the president was expected to be 150 national security advisers, 250 Secret Service agents, 200 public servants, 50 political aides, 15 sniffer dog teams and even five chefs. The presidential 747 was accompanied by a second identical stand-in plane and followed by a third jumbo jet carrying 150 White House journalists, medical staff, advisers, public servants, Secret Service agents, dogs and cooks. It is understood two or three transport planes carrying the presidential helicopter, Marine One, and dozens of motorcade vehicles including limousines, Secret Service wagons, VIP guest vans and an ambulance deployed in Sydney around two days ago to be ready for the president's arrival. The total 1,000-strong delegation is more than three times larger than any other country, including the 300-strong Australian team. Snip http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,22365089-5006009,00.html What’s changed since then? Oh, that’s right, instead of an R designating the Presidents Political party it’s been replace by a D. So it must be (at least according to you guys) that this President is not entitled to the same scope of protection as the ones with the R. It's also just my opinion that the hypocrisy that is evident in this thread knows no bounds.

But it will be his closed-door meetings with world leaders that are likely to prove the most significant of the trip." Paul Harris in New York and Robin McKie The Observer, Sunday 29 March 2009 See: "http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/29/obama-london-visit-uk-g20/print" To me, this is Obama's obnoxious self-gratification (to include over 500 staff members on this trip). Decoy Helicopters and 200 or more Secret Service agents is "overdoing" it a bit! Simply, its being a "Showoff!" Just my Opinion! From A Proud Vietnam Veteran

title: Over 500 Staff to Accompany Obama on Eurpean Trip

content: I was a C-5 loadmaster in a the mid 90s while Clinton was in office, and there had to be at least 500 people that went overseas with him. It would take a half a dozen C-5s to support the WCHA, motorcade, and helicopter support plus extra planes were on alert if needed. Like him or not he is the President and griping about who goes with him is really dumb.
reply: I was a C-5 loadmaster in a the mid 90s while Clinton was in office, and there had to be at least 500 people that went overseas with him. content: Ah yes, US Presidents and their entourages the absolute definition of ostentatious over-consumption. You lot do realise that about 75% of the stuff your head-sheds take on trips is only there for show don't you? Mind you at least Obama's lot chose to only clog up Stanstead airport for a few hours with their three (and that's just on the day - why?) jet carnival. Last time round Bush chose to go to Heathrow (the busiest airport in Europe) and screwed up air-traffic for half the planet.
